segments.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:

segments.pli: “sattime, bhikkhave, dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno parihānāya saṃvattanti.
segments.en: “These seven things lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.

segments.pli: Kammārāmatā, bhassārāmatā, niddārāmatā, saṅgaṇikārāmatā, indriyesu aguttadvāratā, bhojane amattaññutā, santi kho pana saṃghe saṃghakaraṇīyāni; tatra sekho bhikkhu iti paṭisañcikkhati:
segments.en: They relish work, talk, sleep, and company. They don’t guard the sense doors and they eat too much. And when there is Saṅgha business to be carried out, they don’t reflect:

segments.pli: ‘santi kho pana saṃghe therā rattaññū cirapabbajitā bhāravāhino, te tena paññāyissantī’ti attanā tesu yogaṃ āpajjati.
segments.en: ‘There are senior mendicants in the Saṅgha of long standing, long gone forth, responsible. They’ll be known for taking care of this.’ So they try to do it themselves.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, satta dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno parihānāya saṃvattanti.
segments.en: These seven things lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.

segments.pli: Sattime, bhikkhave, dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattanti.
segments.en: These seven things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.

segments.pli: Na kammārāmatā, na bhassārāmatā, na niddārāmatā, na saṅgaṇikārāmatā, indriyesu guttadvāratā, bhojane mattaññutā, santi kho pana saṅghe saṅghakaraṇīyāni; tatra sekho bhikkhu iti paṭisañcikkhati:
segments.en: They don’t relish work, talk, sleep, and company. They guard the sense doors and don’t they eat too much. And when there is Saṅgha business to be carried out, they reflect:

segments.pli: ‘santi kho pana saṅghe therā rattaññū cirapabbajitā bhāravāhino, te tena paññāyissantī’ti attanā na tesu yogaṃ āpajjati.
segments.en: ‘There are senior mendicants in the Saṅgha of long standing, long gone forth, responsible. They’ll be known for taking care of this.’ So they don’t try to do it themselves.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, satta dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattantī”ti.
segments.en: These seven things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.”

suttaplex.blurb: Seven qualities leading to the decline of a mendicant who is a trainee.
